trial_identification.studytitle: Overnight Effects of nCPAP with and without humidification on upper airway function.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Overnight Effects of nCPAP with and without humidification on: inspiratory temperature, humidity, mouth leak, saccharine transit time, nasal lavage and in vitro mucus properties in patients with obstructive sleep apnea.

interventions.interventions:
Participants will be randomised to 3 consecutive nights (Monday, Wednesday and Friday) of
CPAP for one night CPAP + (conventional heated humidification) for one night CPAP + (optimal level of humidity) for one night
Outcome measures:(all measured pre and post each overnight study) Saccharine transit time Mucus physical properties Cytology via lavage Inflammatory mediators Upper airways symptom score

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured pre and post each overnight study

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Measured pre and post each overnight study.
Measured pre and post each overnight study.
Measured pre and post each overnight study.
Measured pre and post each overnight study.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Moderate to severe obstructive sleep panea > 15 AHI > 75% of events must be obstructiveExcessive daytime sleepiness (ESS > 10).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Nasal CPAP intolerance determined in the PSG-CPAP titration studyacute upper airway diseasesmokerCOPDCongestive heart failure.

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
Participants will be randomised to 3 consecutive nights (Monday, Wednesday and Friday) of
CPAP for one night CPAP + (conventional heated humidification) for one night CPAP + (optimal level of humidity) for one night
Outcome measures:(all measured pre and post each overnight study) Saccharine transit time Mucus physical properties Cytology via lavage Inflammatory mediators Upper airways symptom score
